data.pageText: The federal government is comprised of three branches: the executive, the judiciary, and the legislative. Where do federal administrative agencies fall within these three branches of government?

The short answer is that many federal agencies are part of the executive branch of government; however, some administrative agencies are referred to as “independent” agencies, meaning that they function independently of the executive branch, which is headed by the President.

Sometimes a large federal agency will consist of a number of smaller administrative agencies. For instance, the Department of Homeland Security is a cabinet-level federal agency that contains many sub-agencies, such as <abbr title="United States">U.S.</abbr> Customs and Border Protection (<abbr title="Customs and Border Protection">CBP</abbr>), Federal Emergency Management Agency <abbr title="Federal Emergency Management Agency">(FEMA)</abbr>, or the <abbr title="United States">U.S.</abbr> Secret Service.
